paper_abstract: Algebraic program models are designed for the study of the semantic properties of programs on models-program schemas. The design concepts of these models are presented, and a class of models is considered that approximate real sequential programs. Algorithms are constructed that recognize the equivalence of program schemas in models of a given class with practically acceptable complexity. The validity of these algorithms for constructing equivalent transformations (ETs) of program schemas is established.
paper_title: On a class of algebraic models of programs of practical interest
